title: Interesting Times in Statistics Education
description: Pre-COVID musings on trends in statistics education. Appearing in the April 1st, 2020 edition of AMSTAT News, it was not intended to be an April 1st joke. And yet ... The essay was written in December 2019 and publication was anticipated for Feb. 2020. Starting around April 1, COVID-19 became the dominant fact of life for statistics instructors (and everybody else in the world). My sincere apologies for any offense that I might have given readers. I regret that I didnâ€™t keep better track of the changing publication schedule and update the essay accordingly.
